Company Description:
Company Description

BNB Chain is an ecosystem with decentralized governance, EVM-compatible computing platform, and decentralized storage system with over 1,000 dApps deployed and over 1m daily active users (addresses). We are looking for an Executive Director of our BNB Chain foundation. The successful candidate will join the innovative and rapidly evolving field to build a new era of crypto-powered applications.
Job Description:
Job Description

Manage bot setup and optimization for all TechOps channels across, BNB Forum, Telegram group, Github and Discord. 
Accurate ticket tracking across all support channels. Prepare a monthly report for review and identify opportunities. 
Research into cutting edge technologies(i.e. AI tooling) to automate and optimize processes. 
Understanding of BNB Chain ecosystem metrics, including BSC, opBNB and BNB Greenfield. 
Analyst data and provide solutions and suggestions. 
Seek product feedback and track usage/performance, driving our product roadmap
Build and maintain ongoing relationships with multiple stakeholders, both internally and externally. 
Work in a quick changing environment. 

Qualifications

Excellent English in both speaking and writing. (Mandarin would be a plus). 
Familiar with Python, JavaScript, C++ for bot management. 
Understanding of Blockchain Tech would be essential. 
Strong analytical skills
Ability to understand and troubleshoot complex technical issues
Strong communication skills with internal and external stakeholders
Excellent people skills to monitor. 
Interest in blockchain and crypto technologies. 

Additional Information

This is a 3-6 month paid internship. This intern needs to start working in Aug, work for at least three months, and work more than 4 days a week.

Who May Apply

Current university students and recent graduates

What can you expect from a career at BNB Chain?

Become part of the world‚Äôs leading blockchain ecosystem that continues to grow and offers excellent career development opportunities. 
Work alongside diverse, world-class talent, in an environment where learning and growth opportunities are endless. 
Tackle fast-paced, challenging and unique projects. 
Work in a truly global organization, with international teams and a flat organizational structure. 
Enjoy competitive salary and benefits. 
Balance life and work with flexible working hours and casual work attire. 

BNB Chain is committed to being an equal opportunity employer. We believe that having a diverse workforce is fundamental to our success.

Company Description:
Our mission is to develop clear and honest partnerships with our clients and provide direction and support to our candidates. 

Clarrow brings together a team of the leading specialist recruiters focused on the Asia Pacific region. Many of our consultants are degree qualified or have previously worked in the fields they recruit in, giving them specialist knowledge in their chosen verticals and in-depth knowledge of recruitment processes.

We work closely with hiring managers to understand their complex needs and provide guidance on the processes and what candidates are looking for in order to help your business attract top talent in a very candidate short market.

Beyond traditional recruitment we are committed to working with our clients to develop tailored solutions to meet your businesses unique needs. We can offer solutions across SoW, RPO, RoD, outsourced psychometric testing, background checks, video interview responses and post project data and insights to meet your business needs.

Clarrow can help with a complete outsourced payroll solution as well, which offers: online on-boarding and time sheet management systems, outsourced risk and compliance around WHS and insurance, on demand background checks, a generous contractor care and benefits scheme and a dedicated Account Manager to take care of any contractor or hiring manager requests.
Job Description:
About the job
Are you an innovative and ambitious Gen AI developer who is excited about the future of artificial intelligence? 



We are seeking a talented and experienced General AI (Gen AI) developer who will be responsible for designing, building, and deploying advanced AI models and systems that can handle a wide variety of tasks and adapt to new challenges.


What you will do:
Research and develop novel Gen AI architectures, algorithms, and techniques
Build and train large-scale AI models that can understand natural language, perceive and interact with the physical world, and autonomously tackle complex problems
Develop robust, scalable, and efficient AI systems that can be deployed in real-world applications
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (ML engineers, data scientists, product managers, etc.) to integrate Gen AI capabilities into end-user products and services
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field of general artificial intelligence
Document code, algorithms, and design decisions for ease of maintenance and future development


What you will need:
Advanced degree (MS or PhD) in computer science, machine learning, or a related technical field
5+ years of experience in AI/ML research and development, with a focus on general/multi-purpose AI systems
Expertise in deep learning, reinforcement learning, transfer learning, and other cutting-edge AI techniques
Strong programming skills in Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, or similar AI/ML frameworks
Experience in deploying and scaling AI models in production environments
Excellent problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication skills
A passion for advancing the state-of-the-art in general artificial intelligence

Company Description:
About Us

is a rapidly expanding global commodities hedge fund, dedicated to serving institutional clients by providing market leading results.

Our goal is to produce exceptional returns facilitated by an investment research process that leverages our domain expertise across global commodity markets, supply and demand analysis and a novel AI approach.

At Farrer Capital, we foster a culture of learning and collaboration among the world's most talented investment professionals, researchers, and engineers. We‚Äôre a fully distributed, remote-first company, with our growing team located across North and South America, Australia, and Europe.

We empower our team to experiment with their ideas and create commercial solutions that propel their growth and make a real impact.
Job Description:
Who We Are Looking For

We are seeking an exceptional Quantitative Developer with a passion for building cutting-edge solutions to support our expanding quant business at Farrer Capital.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with the Quantitative Team (PM, researchers and engineers) to convert research ideas into production-ready trading strategies.

You will be responsible for developing research infrastructure (including market data, backtesting, and compute) and enhancing our trading platform (covering position management, risk controls, strategy frameworks, deployment, visualisation, and observability).

Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement solutions that convert research ideas into robust trading strategies

Build and enhance research infrastructure and trading platforms to support high-performance trading including alpha estimation, risk modeling, and backtesting components

Building tools for signal blending, simulation, portfolio construction, the research framework, and dashboards

Troubleshooting and resolving any systems related issues and handle the release of code fixes and enhancements

Write clean, well-designed, and thoroughly tested code that meets high engineering standards

Ensure code reliability and performance in a high-stakes trading environment

Requirements

About You

MS in Financial Engineering or a related field

2+ years of experience with Python

Strong software engineering fundamentals with a focus on writing clean, well-tested code

Excellent analytical abilities with a solid foundation in probability and statistics

Experience with mission-critical production code and meticulous attention to detail

Knowledge of FX, Futures, or Options trading is a plus, though not required

Experience with systematic trading strategies or trading platforms (systematic, HFT, or execution) is advantageous but not required

Experience in some of the following areas: Distributed Computing, Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, Quantitative Finance, Data Mining, High-Performance Computing, or Time Series Analysis

You want to work in an environment that recognizes excellence

Opportunities available remotely or via our physical offices in New York, London, and Melbourne

Benefits

Our commitment to high performance outcomes is reflected in competitive salary and performance structures.

We‚Äôre a fully distributed, remote-first, fast-growing company offering flexibility on location. We rely heavily on our written communication skills in order to make it work.

You will be surrounded by exceptional colleagues who embody a culture of authenticity, humility, and excellence. We encourage you to make a lasting impact on our collective culture.

We believe that diversity is critical to our success. We will not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

Job Description:
Position Overview:

As a Quantitative Futures Trader, you will play a critical role in developing and executing algorithmic trading strategies in the futures markets. This position demands a strong quantitative background, a deep passion for financial markets, and a collaborative mindset that thrives in an innovative environment.

Why join us?

Key Responsibilities:

Strategy Development: Research, design, and optimize quantitative trading strategies with a focus on risk management and maximizing profitability.
Algorithmic Trading: Execute strategies using proprietary algorithms, ensuring precision in order execution and effective risk management.
Market Monitoring: Continuously track and analyze market conditions, news, and events to inform trading decisions and strategy adjustments.
Risk Management: Implement and refine risk management protocols to safeguard against trading risks and optimize portfolio performance.
Data-Driven Insights: Apply statistical and data analysis techniques to improve trading models and enhance strategy effectiveness.
Technology Collaboration: Partner with our technology team to innovate and optimize trading infrastructure, including both hardware and software.
Regulatory Compliance: Ensure all trading activities comply with regulatory requirements and internal policies, with prompt reporting of any issues.
Performance Analysis: Maintain comprehensive records of trading activities, evaluating performance metrics to identify areas for improvement.
Team Collaboration: Engage with fellow traders and research teams to share insights, ideas, and market observations that drive success.

Job Details

What We Offer:

A competitive compensation package, including performance-based bonuses.

A collaborative and innovative work environment that fosters growth.

Access to state-of-the-art technology and resources.

Exposure to a diverse range of financial markets and trading strategies.

Career development opportunities within a fast-growing firm.

If you are a highly motivated, analytical individual with a passion for quantitative trading and thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply and be part of our team at [Your Company Name]. Join us in shaping the future of quantitative trading in Chicago.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.

In-depth understanding of financial markets and futures trading.

Proven experience in quantitative trading, algorithmic trading, or a related domain.

Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or C++ for data analysis and strategy development.

Familiarity with statistical modeling, data analysis, and machine learning techniques is a plus.

Strong problem-solving abilities and critical thinking skills, especially in high-pressure trading environments.

Excellent communication and teamwork capabilities.

Adaptability to changing market conditions and a strong aptitude for taking calculated risks.

Let me know if you need any further adjustments!

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button. Quantitative Trader / Futures Trader

Company Description:
Campus Ink is seeking talented and self motivated individuals to join our team as Student Design & Sales Managers! As a Student Designer, you will be responsible for reaching out to prospective clients, creating custom designs, assisting the sales process, and monitoring the production process from start to finish. This is a unique opportunity to work with a rapidly expanding apparel company that specializes in providing high-quality merchandise to colleges and universities across the country.

At Campus Ink, we are dedicated to creating a fun and unique work environment where our team members can thrive. We pride ourselves on our strong company culture and our commitment to providing our employees with the tools they need to succeed. If you are passionate about design, sales, bringing new ideas to the table, and working with people then we want to hear from you!
Job Description:
Responsibilities

Collaborate with fellow student designers to create original and engaging designs that will appeal to our target market
Assist the product development process from start to finish, ensuring that all deadlines are met and that quality standards are upheld
Oversee the sales process, from lead generation to order fulfillment, and ensure that all client needs are met
Maintain relationships with current clients and work to cultivate new business opportunities on and off campus
Working with our marketing team to effectively implement marketing strategies that will drive sales and increase brand awareness
Keep up to date with the latest trends in the fashion industry and apply them to our designs and sales strategies


Requirements

Currently enrolled at a university / college as an undergraduate student
Interested in learning design or being a part of the design process
Strong project management skills and the ability to work well on your own time
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
A passion for the fashion industry and a desire to stay up to date on the latest trends
A flexible and adaptable attitude, with the ability to work independently and in a team-based environment


Benefits

Commission-based pay
Flexible working hours
Opportunity to grow into promotional sales lead and/or internships offered exclusively to Student & Design Sales Managers
Professional development opportunities
Opportunity to develop skills in a variety of industry applicable skills, including sales, marketing, graphic design, and customer relationship management
Opportunity to network with professionals in the industry

A platform for excellence - my client is a leading financial markets recruiting firm with offices in London and Miami. Specialize in recruiting across all asset classes, front, middle and back office, including quant, commodities, FX, rates, and fixed income.


With a client base is predominantly buy-side, and some sell-side accounts, they have a proven track record of transitioning top talent from the sell-side to the buy-side.


With a Miami office is spearheaded by a global top biller, who covers FX Rates & Trading into the buy side. Personally billing over $2 million last year, as the office continues to grow exponentially.


This team are in aggressive growth mode and are looking for talented recruiters to join their dynamic team.
At Higher Group, we spend an unusual amount of time talking and thinking about recruitment. 

We do four things: 

1)	We help recruitment companies find great people. 

2)	We act as career partners to recruitment professionals, helping you identify the opportunities that can take you to the next stage of your career. 
    
3)	We help aspiring recruiters find the right place to start their career- whether you‚Äôre a graduate, salesperson or an ambitious teenager with a point to prove. 

4)	We help entrepreneurial recruitment professionals start their own recruitment companies 

What we think

Recruitment is Important (but hard)

In its most simple form, any company or organisation is just a group of people- trying to achieve something together. As recruiters, we focus all of our efforts on that simple but vital asset- the people. 

Recruitment is Good (but hard)

Despite the tedious recruiter bashing, we know that our industry is a vibrant, exciting and diverse place to work. An industry that gives people the chance to learn important skills, travel the world and get stuck into business in a way other industries just can‚Äôt match. 

Recruitment is Fun (but hard)

No offence to accountants. But can you imagine being an accountant! Staring at spreadsheets all day, every day. Recruitment is the people business- we find people, for people.  Yes, they can be a nightmare. But they can also be fascinating, hilarious and very, very surprising. It‚Äôs like an adventure, but with KPI‚Äôs.

If you have a finance background and are eager to leverage a incredible client base, we want to hear from you. Apply today and take the next step in your career.

Job Description:
Requirements

Conditions of Employment

This is not a remote position.
U.S. Citizenship is required.
Males born after 12/31/1959 must be registered for Selective Service.
Relocation expenses are not authorized.
This is an Excepted Service position.
This position is part of the Bargaining Unit.
Two-year trial period may be required.
Transcripts are required if qualifying based on education or combination of experience and education in lieu of specialized experience.
This is a positive education position. Transcripts are required to be considered for this position.
Selectee may be subject to a background investigation prior to appointment.
Must submit a complete application package online by 11:59 PM EST on the closing date.

Qualifications

All qualifications and eligibility requirements specified in the announcement must be met by the closing date of the job announcement .

 Ideal Candidate Statement 

The ideal Candidate for GS-0904-12, Law Clerk (Trainee) will have a strong academic law school record, currently be serving in a judicial clerkship or law fellowship but have not been admitted to the Bar. The candidate should have excellent legal research and oral and written communication skills. The candidate should also have experience or course study in labor or industrial relations and the National Labor Relations Act.

Basic Eligibility Requirement

In order to meet the basic eligibility requirements, applicants must have at least one of the following:

I have a GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 or above (or equivalent), or am in the top 25 % of my law school class or my school does not use a numerical GPA/rank.
I have previously interned or worked at the NLRB or another labor agency
I have other specialized labor law or labor relations experience

In addition to the Basic Eligibility Requirement , applicants must also meet the following:

Minimum Qualifications

To be eligible for the GS-0904-12 Law Clerk (Trainee) position and grade, applicants must meet all of the following qualifications:

Must have successfully completed a full course of study in a law school accredited by the ABA and have their first professional law degree (JD or LLB).
Must be currently serving in at least a 1-year (or longer) post-law school position as a judicial clerk, honors law clerk, or law fellow, which were started within six (6) months of graduating with first professional law degree (J.D. or LL.B.)
Must not be barred/licensed at the time of application.

OR

Must be currently in process of obtaining an advanced law degree (e.g., LLM or JSD) from a law school accredited by the ABA which was started within six (6) months of graduating with first professional law degree (JD or LL.B.). (Transcripts are required to be submitted.)

These qualifications must be fully supported and articulated in an applicant's resume to receive consideration.

Substitution of education in lieu of specialized experience may not be used for this grade level.

Education

Applicants must have successfully completed a full course of study in a law school accredited by the ABA and have their first professional law degree (JD or LLB).

OR

Applicants must be currently in process of obtaining an advanced law degree (LLM or JSD) from a law school accredited by the ABA.

Education must be accredited by an accredited institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications (particularly positions with a positive education requirement). You MUST provide transcripts or other documentation to support your educational claims. Applicants can verify accreditation here . All education claimed by applicants will be verified by the appointing agency accordingly.

You must meet all qualification requirements. (Required - if applicable) All academic degrees and coursework must be completed at a college or university that has obtained accreditation or pre-accreditation status from an accrediting body recognized by the U.S. Department of Education. For a list of schools that meet this criteria, please click here . All education claimed by applicants will be verified by the appointing agency accordingly.

Special Instructions for Foreign Education: If you are using education completed in foreign colleges or universities to meet the qualification requirements, you must show that the education credentials have been evaluated by a private organization that specializes in interpretation of foreign education programs and such education has been deemed equivalent to that gained in accredited U.S. education programs; or full credit has been given for the courses at a U.S. accredited college or university.

For further information regarding Foreign Education, please click here .

Additional Information

The General Counsel-Headquarters program area of the Honors Program is also accepting applications for a Law Clerk (Trainee) GS-0904-11 (Notice of Vacancy NL25EX12497812CS) and General Attorney (Labor) (Honors Attorney) GS-0905-12 (Notice of Vacancy NL25EX12497729). Additionally, the Board-side and Operations-Field (Regional Offices) have postings for their respective program areas. We encourage those who are interested to review the applicable postings to determine qualifications and/or eligibilities. Please visit the NLRB's Honors Program webpage for additional information.

Supplementary Vacancies

Supplementary vacancies may be filled in addition to the number stated in this announcement.

Equal Employment Opportunity/Reasonable Accommodation

The National Labor Relations Board is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for appointment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sex orientation), age, disability, genetic information, political affiliations, or any other non-merit factor. Applicants with disabilities who need reasonable accommodations for any part of the application and hiring process should contact the Agency's Selective Placement Coordinator by email here . NLRB offers a wide array of reasonable accommodations and programs for individuals with disabilities. (Note: for additional information for job seekers with disabilities, please click on the following website here .)

 Placement Policy 

The posting of this announcement does not obligate management to fill a vacancy or vacancies by promotion. The position will be filled by a new appointment.

The National Labor Relations Board offers career opportunities that feature competitive starting salaries and the potential for performance-based increases, flexible hours, and the ability to achieve and maintain a balanced lifestyle. You will enjoy a range of comprehensive and competitive employment benefits that include Work/Life Balance Programs (Alternative Work Schedules, Telework, Employee Assistance Program, and the Child Care Subsidy Program), the Federal Employees Health Benefits (FEHB) Program, Flexible Spending Accounts, Life Insurance, Long-Term Care Insurance, Thrift Savings Plan, and the Transit Benefit Program.

Company Description:
About the job
Founded in 2015, Ketosource Limited has grown to become the #1 European nutraceutical and health optimisation company in the Ketogenic & Fasting space.

Our success has been founded on raising the standard in three areas:

Scientific Foundation: Our team comprises scientists and we undertake research to back our solutions with evidence and data.
Quality Standards: We‚Äôre raising the standard of nutrition products to pharma-like standards. Through formulation to production we work to the highest active ingredient purity and lowest contaminant levels. 
Lifestyle Integration: Health is a human challenge. We acknowledge this and work with people to understand their obstacles and integrate solutions that work with their lifestyle for the long term.

Our Solutions Combine The Following

Health products: We develop and distribute a range of premium keto and fasting nutrition products. 
Digital services: We leverage technology to best support our customers‚Äô journey to results. These include online courses, knowledge databases (video, text), AI and algorithms, and coaching services.
Strategic partner solutions: We work closely with other unique companies with the best solutions that complement our own.

We are a small team focused on making a meaningful impact on the health of humanity. Our mission is to build health solutions that help humanity live longer and better quality lives. We are driven by ambitious goals, fast execution, and a strong sense of urgency. Join us if you want to shape the next generation of health optimisation companies.
Job Description:
The Role

This is what we‚Äôll expect you to work on. Your primary ownership areas will be:

Increasing the size of the customer base
Improving the lifetime duration of our customer relationships
Improving customer results via education and empowerment

Pre and Post Purchase Funnel Optimisation

Product Page Optimisation
Optimising product pages to reflect our brand and unique value add consistently and the stand out features of our products to attract ideal-fit customers
Refining the design of workflows to improve reviews quality and number
Conversion Optimization
Ideating, designing and implementing new content and page split tests
Analytics and decision making to improve conversion rates over time

Traffic Acquisition

Ranking Optimisation
Use data-driven research and workflows to constantly work on and improve the rankings of products
Ads Optimisation
Refining and executing on optimisation workflows to consistently improve KPIs on TACOS and ranking objectives
Creation and split testing of new ad content

Email Workflows

Design and refine email workflows across the entire lifecycle of customers
Refine the organisation system for email workflows and maintain over time
Write and publish emails according to specific style guidelines in line with brand and persona
Split test of emails and email workflows to improve key email metrics

Content Planning & Storyboarding

For the use in email, landing page and social media design specific content pieces to achieve target outcomes
Create storyboards and outlines for content (video, text) to provide to content creators

Pricing Analysis & Reporting

 Follow pricing workflows to update pricing analytics on monthly basis
Isolate any pricing issues and highlight in reports to CEO

Monthly Growth Marketing Reporting

Report on and explain the drivers of KPI changes each month
Create, refine and present action plans to course correct or improve on gains to achieve KPI outcomes over time

Ad Hoc Project and Sprint Activity

Beyond these activities there will be adhoc project involvement based on your strengths.

Ideal Profile

Your Background

Work Experience

You should have at least internship experience in a similar activity, up to 2 years of experience. This must include:
Growth marketing activities that grew the size and loyalty of a customer base for a DTC/ B2C Company.
Experience with growing these channels specifically:
 Amazon channel customer base (most important)
 Shopify (or other DTC platform) customer base

Education

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a STEM field (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, Biology) from an accredited institution is preferred.

For this role we are looking for exceptional strengths in:

Written Communication

This includes emails, and general writing for content.
Formatting and visuals - you should also have any eye for presentation to be able to check and ensure the quality of visual content.

Language Abilities

First: Your English must be flawless as this will be the main working language.
Second: Other advantageous languages include German, Spanish, Italian, and French.

Standards and Attention to Detail

You should have exceptionally high standards for your work and that of others and the attention to detail to be able to spot areas to improve.
Ability to assess standards: When given a set of criteria you should be able to clearly assess standards based on these criteria.

Tech

You should be very comfortable with tech - we are a company that leverages the best tech/ and latest systems - so understanding and using these is part of virtually all your activity.
Specifically you should understand and be very comfortable with:
Notion (Kanban Boards, Tables, Pages)
Google Workspace (Gmail, Google Calendar, Google Sheets)
ChatGPT (AI prompts and use)
Marketing Tools

You should be comfortable with SAAS focused on marketing activities such as:

Email Campaign Management Tools
Marketing Analytics and Intelligence
Marketing Workflow
Systems Use
At Ketosource we build, refine and use systems consistently to allow us to perform at a very high level and constantly improve.

Company Description:
World leader in engineering and R&D services, Capgemini Engineering combines its broad industry knowledge and cutting-edge technologies in digital and software to support the convergence of the physical and digital worlds. Coupled with the capabilities of the rest of the Group, it helps clients to accelerate their journey towards Intelligent Industry. Capgemini Engineering has 60,000 engineer and scientist team members in over 30 countries across sectors including Aeronautics, Space, Defense, Naval, Automotive, Rail, Infrastructure & Transportation, Energy, Utilities & Chemicals, Life Sciences, Communications, Semiconductor & Electronics, Industrial & Consumer, Software & Internet.  

Capgemini Engineering is an integral part of the Capgemini Group, a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of ‚Ç¨22.5 billion.

Job Description:
Your Mission üì¢

Position Overview: We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior Python Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will possess extensive knowledge in developing GUI applications, ensuring thread-safe operations, and handling various file types. Proficiency in PyQt5, pandas, openpyxl, and handling Microsoft Office file formats is essential. The candidate should demonstrate strong problem-solving abilities, excellent communication skills, and the capacity to work independently as well as in a collaborative team environment.
Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain Python-based applications with a focus on GUI development using PyQt5.
Implement thread-safe applications to ensure robust and efficient performance.
Handle and manipulate various file types, including but not limited to Microsoft Office files (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and other common formats.
Utilize pandas for data manipulation and analysis.
Work with openpyxl for creating, reading, and modifying Excel files.
Develop and manage presentations using the python-pptx library.
Ensure code quality, maintainability, and adhere to best practices in software development.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
Troubleshoot and resolve software defects and issues in a timely manner.
Mentor junior developers and provide technical guidance as needed.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends, technologies, and best practices.


Your profile

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in Python development.
Proven experience in developing GUI applications using PyQt5.
Strong understanding of threading and concurrent programming in Python.
Expertise in file handling and manipulation, particularly with Microsoft Office file formats.
Proficiency in pandas for data manipulation and analysis.
Hands-on experience with openpyxl for Excel file operations.
Experience with python-pptx for PowerPoint presentation creation and modification.
Familiarity with other relevant Python libraries and tools.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with other GUI frameworks and libraries.
Familiarity with version control systems like Git.
Knowledge of database systems and SQL.
Prior experience in a leadership or mentorship role.
Contributions to open source projects.
Competencies:

Technical Proficiency: In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience with Python, PyQt5, pandas, openpyxl, and python-pptx.
Problem-Solving: Ability to analyze complex issues and develop efficient solutions.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to convey technical concepts effectively.
Team Collaboration: Strong team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues.
Attention to Detail: Meticulous approach to code quality, testing, and documentation.
Adaptability: Ability to quickly learn new technologies and adapt to changing requirements.


Our offer

As part of a service line who delivers mobile networks services to the main market players, you will have the opportunity to work in several national and international projects.
Multi-vendor and multi-scope project; From massive national-wide rollouts to highly specialized feature introduction activities.
Leadership and Team coordination skills development when responsible to lead a small team and work as customer POC for the day-by-day activities.
Be part of a 150+ team that is constantly evolving and adapt to the new market needs (Open-RAN, Business Intelligence, Data Manipulation )
